text: Reinhard Genzel (born 24 March 1952) is a German astrophysicist. He was born in Bad Homburg vor der HÃ¶he, Germany. His works relate to infrared and submillimetre astronomy. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1995. Genzel was awarded the 2020 Nobel Prize for Physics, which he shared with Andrea Ghez and Roger Penrose. ==References== Category:1952 births Category:Living people Category:Astrophysicists Category:German academics Category:German astronomers Category:German Nobel Prize winners Category:German physicists Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:University of California, Berkeley faculty
title: Reinhard Genzel
